intro: Navia corrugata, commonly known as the wrinkled navia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, corrugated leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Navia corrugata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
